column3: Would this make it into 0.9.2? It applies to the branch, but I don't know how strict your string freeze policy is.\n
@shshshsh It's too late for this to make it into 0.9.2, it's not a critical fix.\n
@laanwj Thx, I've added the cast and it worked.\n

@ShadowOfHarbringer: your bitcoin-nftf repo added a commit referencing a Boost bug that coincidentally had the same number as this pull request. If you log in and look at the right menu of this page, there's an "Unsubscribe" link with a speaker symbol next to it that you can use.\n

Why do you remove the `MAX_ORPHAN_BLOCKS` constant, it can be used so we don't get back a magic value again. Also you should use it in the description of `-maxorphanblocks`, see `-par` on how do do that.\n
Yes, better to rename it to DEFAULT_MAX_ORPHAN_BLOCKS.\n
This doesnt really belong to "Connection options:". Can you please move this one block upwards to the general options below -loadblock?\n

Problem: .size() returns an unsigned type. GetArg a signed one. Better use:

```
if (mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.size() <= (size_t)std::max(0, GetArg(...))
```

@sipa:

```
main.cpp:1163:114: error: no matching function for call to 'max(int, int64_t)'
     if (mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.size() <= (size_t)std::max(0, GetArg("-maxorphanblocks", DEFAULT_MAX_ORPHAN_BLOCKS)))
...
main.cpp:1163:114: note:   deduced conflicting types for parameter 'const _Tp' ('int' and 'int64_t {aka long long int}')
```

I don't know enough C++ to fix it.

both sides of std::max must have the same type -- try

```
(size_t)std::max(0LL, GetArg("-maxorphanblocks", DEFAULT_MAX_ORPHAN_BLOCKS)))
```

Edit: or even better as it uses explicit types; as int64_t is not the same as LL on all architectures (_sigh_)

```
(size_t)std::max((int64_t)0, GetArg("-maxorphanblocks", DEFAULT_MAX_ORPHAN_BLOCKS)))
```
